definition: to face into the wind/against the wind/fig. against the law

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to lie to (facing the wind)

sentences.english: The steamer was beating along the coast.
Encountering a headwind at night is a worry.
sentences.chinese: 晚上頂風是最值得擔心的。

sentences.english: Despite the wind and the rain, they plodded on until they reached the cottage.
sentences.chinese: 儘管頂風冒雨，他們仍艱難地走到那座農舍。

sentences.english: The commodity market may also be a long-term headwind for the global economy .
sentences.chinese: 大宗商品市場長期來說也可能與全球經濟頂風而行。

sentences.english: The quartermaster swung the ship into the wind and laid it by.
sentences.chinese: 舵工調轉船頭使船頂風停下。

sentences.english: The three wolves moved off upwind in a tight little group.
sentences.chinese: 那三隻狼緊緊挨着，頂風離去。
我們的船頂風逆浪航行。

sentences.english: This paper mainly introduces the frequency control technique and technical innovation for large-type roof fan.
sentences.chinese: 簡介了大型屋頂風機變頻調速技術及技術創新性。

sentences.english: The headwind chapped the cyclist's lips.
The wind was blowing hard,and the ship was forced to lay to.
sentences.chinese: 風颳得正緊，船被迫頂風停駛。

sentences.english: Visitors can drive up to the top of Mesa Verde on a winding mountain road.
sentences.chinese: 遊客可以開車沿着頂風的山路來到梅薩維德的頂部。

sentences.english: When our ship received the signal, she hove to.
sentences.chinese: 我們的船接到信號後就頂風停航了。

sentences.english: The ship was forced to lay by in the storm wind.
sentences.chinese: 船在暴風中被迫頂風停駛。

sentences.english: Secondly, the economic interests of individual localities driven, committed against the wind .
sentences.chinese: 其次，個別地方受經濟利益的驅動，頂風作案。

sentences.english: We had to lie to because of the storm wind.
sentences.chinese: 由於碰上暴風我們只得頂風停船。

sentences.english: The large ship was easily tacked into the wind.
sentences.chinese: 那艘大船輕易地調頭頂風航行。

definition: to kill and burn (idiom); murder and arson
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to decapitate/to behead
to run away/to flee in disarray
to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
to look for trouble
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
light cavalry/light motorcycle/moped
